input_args.examples: {'document_id': ['0000059', '0000059', '0000059', '0000059'], 'document_source': ['NIHSeniorHealth', 'NIHSeniorHealth', 'NIHSeniorHealth', 'NIHSeniorHealth'], 'document_url': ['http://nihseniorhealth.gov/psoriasis/toc.html', 'http://nihseniorhealth.gov/psoriasis/toc.html', 'http://nihseniorhealth.gov/psoriasis/toc.html', 'http://nihseniorhealth.gov/psoriasis/toc.html'], 'category': [None, None, None, None], 'umls_cui': ['C0033860', 'C0033860', 'C0033860', 'C0033860'], 'umls_semantic_types': ['T047', 'T047', 'T047', 'T047'], 'umls_semantic_group': ['Disorders', 'Disorders', 'Disorders', 'Disorders'], 'synonyms': [None, None, None, None], 'question_id': ['0000059-11', '0000059-14', '0000059-15', '0000059-16'], 'question_focus': ['Psoriasis', 'Psoriasis', 'Psoriasis', 'Psoriasis'], 'question_type': ['causes', 'exams and tests', 'treatment', 'treatment'], 'question': ['What causes Psoriasis ?', 'How to diagnose Psoriasis ?', 'What are the treatments for Psoriasis ?', 'What are the treatments for Psoriasis ?'], 'answer': ['Although the cause of psoriasis is not completely understood, scientists believe it is related to a problem with a type of blood cells called T cells. These cells normally travel through the bloodstream to help fight an infection, but in people with psoriasis, they attack the bodys skin cells by mistake.', "In most cases, your primary care doctor can diagnose psoriasis simply by examining your skin. If your doctor isn't sure if you have psoriasis, he or she may order a biopsy. This involves removing a small sample of skin and looking at it under a microscope.", 'The goals of psoriasis treatment are to change the course of the disease by interfering with the increased production of skin cells, and to remove scales and smooth rough skin.', 'There are many types of treatments. Many are medicines and other treatments your doctor will have to prescribe. But there are other types of treatments you can buy without a prescription or try on your own. Some treatments for psoriasis are applied to the directly to the skin. Some use light to treat skin lesions. Others are taken by mouth or injected.']}
